documents.document: @TennantNicolas Enjoyed your brief appearance in Denial! Hope all well.
The launch of Breitbart in France has been delayed https://t.co/9ysjPPQQnS
The search for a "providential man" - excellent @FT Big Read by @ChassNews on the French election https://t.co/Ut36J8OUPG
This is quite the letter from Congressman Patrick T McHenry to Janet Yellen https://t.co/4nJPIG5xwd
This came out at the height of the last, Bush-inspired, wave of French (and European) anti-Americanism. Trump has m… https://t.co/ZaKU6vGQvj
.@ChrisGiles_ on Theresa Tsipras https://t.co/NPoC2ZpsR8
Guillermo Ortiz, former governor of the Bank of Mexico, on Trump and the future of Nafta https://t.co/wNh29ERQLS
.@philipstephens on how France could resist the populist tide https://t.co/pqNgSXHhjz
@MichaelfAdam @b_judah He might do, but it's too late. Macron has the wind in his sails.
Per @franceinfo, Penelope Fillon said in 2007: "I've never been my husband's assistant."
@AlecMacGillis I hear Ralph Ellison and James Baldwin are doin' great work, too. Beautiful work. The best work.
.@JamilAnderlini on the chilling case of Xiao Jianhua https://t.co/jljSpG4PR8
It's looking dicey for Fillon https://t.co/6cV85eu2iS
@duncanrobinson Don't forget the Russian loans https://t.co/I6Kj97AiMQ
Good profile of Philippot, but longer story to tell about dédiabolisation that goes back to Bruno Mégret in the 90s. https://t.co/PtYczN7uyR
In the grand scheme of things, this is not the most pressing issue, but @mePadraigReidy is right nonetheless https://t.co/ip5rinaQLO
Very useful summary of what we know so far about "l'affaire Fillon" https://t.co/BYvoanD5YI
Nice piece by @austeni on what the Pope's battle with the Knights of Malta really means https://t.co/Yc9v5lURtd
@DavidMarkHerman I read and enjoyed it last night, David.
In memoriam - this morning's book post https://t.co/KEp55wEIp8
.@benoithamon is struggling to rally his party behind him after beating Valls https://t.co/uepMRo6StY
"A case study in over-promotion" - @JananGanesh on Theresa May https://t.co/ILYgY2Ivhd
Going to see Denial tomorrow. Reacquainting myself with this by @RichardEvans36 in preparation https://t.co/5yVep6hknF
@StuartMaconie Oh man, that was an extraordinary combination of analysis and eulogy. Biit about having the snare off was particularly good.
Jah Wobble fascinating on the genius of Jaki Liebezeit on @StuartMaconie's show right now. "A tremendous humility in the playing."
@AgnesCPoirier @PedderSophie Which way do you think he'll jump?
@tom_nuttall Some in the party have started jumping ship already. Royal might be the first "elephante" to show her hand.
@PedderSophie When is Bayrou going to show his hand?
@StuartMaconie Wonderful and fitting tribute to Jaki. He's up there with Tony Williams and Tony Allen in my drumming canon.
Can and Thundercat so far - @StuartMaconie's Freak Zone on @BBC6Music is essential listening this evening. Sustenance in dark times.
Right, time to settle down with this https://t.co/YZUlLNoV5P
Listening to #PrimairesGauche coverage on @franceinfo. Result still not in, but everything points to a victory for @benoithamon.
.@jacobwe on the horrible historical echoes of Trump's executive order https://t.co/1e9HfqgRXJ
Results expected between 7.15 and 7.45 #primairePS
In other news, turnout in the second round of the French centre-left primary is up https://t.co/6ISSVzORGF
This account of the maevolence and incompetence of Trump's executive order is devastating https://t.co/zPy5irEYtv
Follow @GeorgeProchnik as he tweets Stefan Zweig's account of an earlier headlong descent into the abyss.
Giving a last bump to Stephen Sedley's elegant analysis of the role of the UK Supreme Court in today's @ftweekend https://t.co/O4qQ4zKZpy
This is a great job for someone at my alma mater https://t.co/F6Noxp2B5R
@djmgaffneyw4 gorgeous aren't they? Acquired over the past year at various locations, including @BooknRecordBar and @RecklessRecords.
.@bluenoterecords' mid-70s re-issue series was a triumph. Current status: Art Pepper - Early Art https://t.co/IZkkQOFTsM
"Using a long spoon, I confirm the absence of bacon" - @henrymance has lunch with Daniel Hannan https://t.co/p6auXsxVna
Oenological discovery of the week: South Australian (not Austrian) Gruner Veltliner https://t.co/YotaBOW7ha
Really good piece by @JKynge on China's illiberal globalism https://t.co/rXR3atEAdX
Nice profile of Damien Chazelle, the FT's Person in the News this week, by @MattGarrahan https://t.co/pFpfFYvSFD
@duncanrobinson Some photos here of @manuelvalls not looking angry https://t.co/hoV2nAMTmE
British Alignment With Trump Threatens European Order https://t.co/1mRtEfiGdR

One of the pieces I'm most proud of having commissioned: the late David Cesarani on Shoah in 2010 https://t.co/PDYGFJhLB0
I once interviewed CL: "You asked me where is my homeland ... it is there, in the constant struggle against death" https://t.co/UDtG2wcbzR
If you've never seen Lanzmann's Shoah, go tomorrow. One of the greatest works of art of the 20th century https://t.co/bG0JqZVBDa

If there's a teenager in your house, chances are they're trafficking in clothes - excellent column by @johngapper https://t.co/8yn0CuGFkX
.@LesEchos picks up on @EmmanuelMacron's@FT op-ed (vi @ChassNews) https://t.co/PGqDdQ1T8v
I'm not sure if Kellyanne Conway or Sean Spicer read *him* at college, but there it is ...
You may have heard that thinking hard about truth, facts etc is a peculiarly French affair - well, this is JL Austin https://t.co/6c7ooz1rkz
With May in Number 10, the joke is no longer on geographers - very nice piece by geography graduate @GeorgeWParker https://t.co/3u13k9pS8D
While Macron urges reboot for Franco-German engine, Russophile Fillon tells Merkel to soften her stance on Putin https://t.co/7koCzYYu2c
The US is leaving Europe to make its own choices - @EmmanuelMacron writes for @ftcomment https://t.co/ijugljbft2
Jim Gallagher wrote about Nicola Sturgeon's vacillations on Brexit last week. Where does she go next? https://t.co/ufPmpTszKB
What would be useful now is one of JL Austin's "Saturday mornings" devoted to differences between a "lie", an "untruth" and a "falsehood".
Good piece on John Cale. I'd forgotten that he played on Nick Drake's Bryter Later https://t.co/RPbtDLwHaK

Fog-bound Burgess Park https://t.co/ZaIa9F54Cc

He's confusing this with a stump speech.
@JananGanesh Definitely France. If anything, they're even more hopped up on 'grandeur' than we or the Americans are.
Linda Colley on Britain's endless search for a global role https://t.co/ZIkTeSUHgb
@JohnRentoul @alanbeattie Alan is right that it's not a recent confection. Cf this by Milton Friedman from 1951 https://t.co/bdH71O6DGd
@olivialanguage Arthur love. I'm spending my day off profitably https://t.co/QYLlcvrgJh
